page.title: 03POPULATION OF INVERURIE
page.content:
At present in 1985 the population of Inverurie is 8900.In recent years the town has grown in size. This is mainly due to the discovery of oil in the North Sea. This brought new industries to the North East of Scotland and a number of oil related industries have been situated in or near Inverurie.
The industries also brought people. Many people who live in Inverurie work in the area, but many more commute every day to work nearer Aberdeen.
The people who do work in or near Inverurie are mainly employed in shops, offices, agriculture and the paper mill. The paper mill is the largest single place of employment in the area.
